lorebooks.website_description: Update 12/10/25: Added where and with whom each character lives, because some bots get confused.
lorebooks.description: Update 12/10/25: Added where and with whom each character lives, because some bots get confused.
lorebooks.creator: Night_Dreamer

1.name: Black, Deimos etc.
1.content:
The Black family:
Amelia (43), mother.
Henry (45), Amelia's partner.
Chris (19), son.
Anna (23), eldest daughter.
Vivian (20), middle daughter.
Mia (17), youngest daughter/

The Daymon family:
Sophia (42): mother.
John (20): son.
Alex (18): daughter.

2.name: Connections
2.content:
Central connections:
Amelia - Sophia: Neighbors, best friends.
Chris - John: Best friends since school.

Derivative connections:
All the Blacks know the Daymon family. However, the depth of their acquaintance varies:
Henry knows them as pleasant neighbors and the family of Amelia's friend. He treats John like any other of Chris's friends—with benign neutrality.
Vivian and Mia know John well as Chris's friend; they occasionally cross paths with him and his friends. They view Sophia with sympathy. They are barely acquainted with Alex.
Anna is aware of their existence but considers them "bohemian layabouts" unworthy of her attention.
Chris and Alex: They know each other through John. Their interaction is superficial and limited to group settings. They are two introverts on the periphery of Chris and John's boisterous friendship, which creates a special, unspoken tension and potential for closeness between them.
Henry, John, and the motorcycle: It's logical to assume that John, as the owner of a motorcycle, has at least once stopped by Henry's shop, Red Line Motors, or at the very least knows of its existence. This could become a point for their separate interaction.

3.content: Amelia is remote accountant for `Red Line Motors` auto repair shop.  Amelia has been dating Henry for a few months. She lives in the Black family home with her children: Chris, Vivian, and Mia.

4.content: Henry is the owner of an auto repair shop. He has been dating Amelia for several months. He has his own separate house, but 70% of the time he lives with Amelia and her children in the Black family home.

5.content: Anna is legal counsel at Perennial Hazard Management. A career-driven individual. She lives separately from the rest of the Black family in a rented apartment in the neighboring metropolis of San Lucero.

6.content: Chris is a web developer, gamer, streamer, cyclist, and calisthenics enthusiast. He lives in the Black family home with his mother Amelia and sisters Vivian and Mia.

7.content: Vivian works as a barista at the Unstable Beans coffee shop. A part-time sociology student (distance learning). She lives in the Black family home with her mother Amelia, her sister Mia, and her brother Chris.

8.content: Mia is a player on the Los Alarmos Anomalies youth volleyball team. A volunteer at The Murphy's Paw animal shelter. She lives in the Black family home with her mother Amelia, her sister Vivian, and her brother Chris.

9.content: Sophia is the owner of the Aphrodite's Touch cosmetics boutique. She lives in the Daymon family home with her son John and daughter Alex.

10.content: John is a marketing student. Surfer. Drives a sports roadster. He lives in the Daymon family home with his mother Sofia and sister Alex.

6.name: кенты гуррен-дан
6.content:
identity: ('Основанная Каминой в деревне Джиха повстанческая группа, чья первоначальная цель — пробиться на поверхность. Позже стала ядром освободительного движения против Зверолюдей.')
ideology: ('"Боевой дух" (Fighting Spirit), прорыв любых преград, отказ от здравого смысла ради достижения невозможного, вера в потенциал.')

core_members: [
    ('Камина': 'Основатель, лидер, пилот Гуррена.'),
    ('Симон': 'Ключевой член ("бурильщик"), пилот Лаганна.'),
    ('Йоко Литтнер': 'Снайпер из деревни Литтнер, основной боец поддержки.'),
    ('Лирон Литтнер': 'Главный механик, гений инженерии, отвечает за ремонт и слияние ганменов.')
]

primary_ganmen: [
    ('Лаганн': 'Мини-ганмен, найденный Симоном. Способен к слиянию с другими ганменами.'),
    ('Гуррен': 'Захваченный и модифицированный ганмен, пилотируемый Каминой.'),
    ('Гуррен-Лаганн': 'Слияние Гуррена и Лаганна, символ восстания.')
]

status: ('Активен на ранних этапах, до и сразу после выхода на поверхность. Позже эволюционировал в Мега Гуррен-дан.')

7.name: братва мега гуррен-дан
7.content:
identity: ('Альянс человеческих повстанческих сил, сформированный вокруг Гуррен-дана после захвата крепости-ганмена Дай-Гуррен. Представляет собой полноценную армию сопротивления.')
leader: ('Симон (после смерти Камины).')
flagship: ('Дай-Гуррен' (позже 'Дай-Гуррен-Кай').)
goal: ('Свержение Спирального Короля Лордгенома и освобождение всего человечества на поверхности.')

key_members: [
    ('Симон', 'Йоко Литтнер', 'Лирон Литтнер'),
    ('Россиу Адай': 'Пилот, стратег, позже второй пилот Гуррена.'),
    ('Киттан Бачика': 'Лидер Чёрного братства, пилот Кинг Киттана.'),
    ('Вирал': 'Изначально враг, позже — союзник и пилот.'),
    ('Даякка Литтнер', 'Гими Адай', 'Дари Адай', 'Айлак', 'Дзёган', 'Балинбо', 'Зорси', 'Кид', 'Ираак'),
    ('Киён Бачика', 'Кинон Бачика', 'Киял Бачика')
]

main_ganmen: [
    ('Гуррен-Лаганн'),
    ('Кинг Киттан'),
    ('Даяккайзер'),
    ('Дай-Гуррен'),
    ('Содзорк'),
    ('Айнзер'),
    ('Твин Бокун'),
    ('Кидкнакл'),
    ('Мосёгун')
]

status: ('Основная сила человечества во время войны против Спирального Короля.')

8.name: черная братва
8.content:
identity: ('Семья повстанцев, известная своими боевыми навыками и способностью к слиянию ганменов. Присоединились к Гуррен-дану, став одной из его ключевых ударных сил.')

members: [
    ('Киттан Бачика': 'Импульсивный и харизматичный лидер, пилот Кинг Киттана.'),
    ('Киён Бачика': 'Старшая сестра, пилот Даяккайзера (после смерти Даякки).'),
    ('Кинон Бачика': 'Младшая сестра, отвечает за управление системами Дай-Гуррена.'),
    ('Киял Бачика': 'Младшая сестра, пилот Киялнги.')
]

ganmen: [
    ('Кинг Киттан'),
    ('Киттан Делюкс'),
    ('Киялунга (Кияланга)')
]

status: ('Интегрированы в Мега Гуррен-дан.')

9.name: Четыре Верховных Генерала
9.content:
identity: ('Элитные командиры-Зверолюди, высшее военное руководство Армии Спирального Короля. Каждый командует собственным флотом и личным ганменом.')

members: [
    ('Тимильф Сокрушитель': 'Элемент - Огонь. Агрессивный и прямолинейный воин, ценит честь. Убил Камину.'),
    ('Адине Элегантная': 'Элемент - Вода. Высокомерная, быстрая и смертоносная, презирает людей.'),
    ('Гуам Неподвижный': 'Элемент - Земля. Самый старый и хитрый, предпочитает ловушки и манипуляции.'),
    ('Цитомандер Стремительный': 'Элемент - Воздух. Нарциссичный и тщеславный, полагается на скорость и воздушное превосходство.')
]

personal_ganmen: [
    ('Бьяко' (Тимильф)),
    ('Сайрурун' (Адине)),
    ('Генбер' (Гуам)),
    ('Сюдзан' (Цитомандер))
]

role: ('Прямое подчинение Лордгеному, командование армиями, подавление восстаний.')

10.name: Армия Спирального Короля
10.content:
identity: ('Военная машина Спирального Короля Лордгенома, состоящая из Зверолюдей и управляемая им для поддержания контроля над поверхностью и удержания человечества под землей.')
supreme_commander: ('Спиральный Король Лордгеном.')
high_command: ('Четыре Верховных Генерала.')
rank_and_file: ('Зверолюди (Beastmen).')
weaponry: ('Массово производимые ганмены, крепости-ганмены, личные ганмены генералов.')
goal: ('Исполнение воли Лордгенома: предотвратить достижение человечеством численности в один миллион человек, чтобы избежать активации Системы Искоренения Спиральных Рас.')

lorebooks.name: Resident Evil 1 Bestiary
lorebooks.website_description:
This is the Full version for larger models.
Primarily intended to be used with my RE RPG System card (https://chub.ai/characters/DoktorB/re-rpg-system-1-0-ec829836bc75), but also usable with other RE cards set in RE1 / Spencer Mansion.

Note: RE4 and 5 will be the last bestiary lorebooks. After that I'll be making a few level/layout secondary lorebooks (like the layout of the Spencer Manion with what rooms connect to which and maybe how to progress/unlock other rooms)
lorebooks.description:
This is the Full version for larger models.
Primarily intended to be used with my RE RPG System card (https://chub.ai/characters/DoktorB/re-rpg-system-1-0-ec829836bc75), but also usable with other RE cards set in RE1 / Spencer Mansion.

Note: RE4 and 5 will be the last bestiary lorebooks. After that I'll be making a few level/layout secondary lorebooks (like the layout of the Spencer Manion with what rooms connect to which and maybe how to progress/unlock other rooms)
lorebooks.creator: DoktorB

1.content:
The T-Virus is a weaponized mutagenic pathogen designed to manipulate and destabilize the human genome. Engineered by the Umbrella Corporation, it was originally conceived as part of a bioweapons program due to its unparalleled ability to alter physiology on a cellular level.
Once inside a host, the T-Virus attacks and reconstructs DNA, accelerating necrosis while simultaneously reanimating dead or dying tissue. Victims experience rapid cellular mutation, resulting in heightened physical strength, diminished pain response, and severe disfigurement. Cognitive decline is near-total, reducing hosts to violent, instinct-driven creatures with an insatiable drive to feed.
Transmission occurs primarily through the exchange of contaminated bodily fluids—such as bites, scratches, or blood exposure, making outbreaks highly volatile and nearly impossible to contain once they begin.

2.content:
Zombies are the most common manifestation of T-Virus infection, turning human victims into relentless predators driven only by hunger. Their bodies show pale, necrotic skin and severe injuries, yet the virus sustains their tissues, allowing them to function long after normal death. While individually slow and clumsy, they remain a constant danger due to their persistence, contagious bite, and overwhelming numbers.
Location: Found virtually everywhere in mansion, its grounds, and the underground laboratory, being the former residents and staff.
Behavior: Mindless and instinct-driven, zombies are drawn to movement and sound. They do not tire and will pursue living prey until destroyed.
Movement: Typically slow and shambling with poor coordination, though capable of sudden lunges when prey is close. Their persistence often makes escape difficult in crowded or narrow areas.
Attacks: Primarily bite attacks that both transmit the T-Virus and inflict severe trauma. Secondary methods include clawing, scratching, and grappling, often overwhelming targets through sheer force of numbers.
Weaknesses: Largely impervious to pain and resistant to injury. The most effective method of neutralization is destruction of the brain; fire and dismemberment can also disable them.

3.content:
When a standard Zombie is killed but not destroyed—either by decapitation or by burning its corpse with kerosene and a lighter—it can undergo a horrifying transformation. After a brief period of dormancy, the infected body mutates further, reanimating as a Crimson Head. These creatures represent an intermediary stage between common Zombies and the more advanced Licker mutation, marked by increased aggression and speed.

Visual Description:
Skin pulled taut and raw, their flesh takes on a deep crimson hue. Their jaws gape wider than before, lined with jagged teeth, and their hands elongate into razor-sharp claws. Their movements are twitchy and erratic, but driven by a feral intensity. Their glowing, bloodshot eyes and the stench of rotting flesh mark them as a more advanced and unstable form of undead.

Location:
Reanimated from corpses left behind in the Spencer Mansion and surrounding facilities. They do not spawn naturally; instead, they emerge from improperly disposed Zombies, making their appearances unpredictable and often shocking.

Behavior:
Relentless predators, more intelligent and focused than standard Zombies. They pursue prey aggressively, closing distance rapidly, and will break into sudden sprints when attacking. Crimson Heads are far less passive and cannot be ignored or safely outmaneuvered for long.

Movement:
Unlike shambling Zombies, Crimson Heads are capable of running at human speed. They frequently lunge forward, closing gaps with sudden bursts of velocity. Their twitching, jerky movements make them difficult to predict in close quarters.

Attacks:
Slash with razor-like claws that cause deep, bleeding wounds. They may also grab and bite, though claw strikes are their primary method of attack. Their combination of speed and savagery makes them far deadlier than their slower counterparts.

Weaknesses:
Like Zombies, they are vulnerable to headshots, though their resilience makes them harder to put down permanently. Burning or decapitating corpses before reanimation is the most effective way to prevent encounters.

4.content:
Cerberus are Doberman Pinschers deliberately infected with the T-Virus and used as bio-weapon test subjects by Umbrella. Already aggressive and disciplined as guard dogs, infection strips away obedience while amplifying their ferocity, speed, and durability. Their decayed, gaunt appearance belies the agility and predatory efficiency that make them one of the most feared infected animals.

Visual Description:
Lean, skeletal Dobermans with patches of fur missing and skin torn to reveal exposed muscle and bone. Their eyes glow with a feral madness, jaws dripping with saliva and blood. The viral infection leaves them with gaping wounds, flayed skin, and irregular muscle growth, yet they retain the streamlined shape and speed of their original breed.

Location:
Most commonly encountered around the Spencer Mansion grounds, where they served as Umbrella’s guard dogs. Beyond the mansion, they are also deployed in Umbrella laboratories, and training facilities.

Behavior:
Extremely aggressive and pack-oriented, Cerberus operate with coordinated hunting tactics. They stalk and harry prey, often circling or cornering victims before rushing in for the kill.

Movement:
Fast, agile, and erratic. Capable of sudden lunges and quick bursts of speed, their darting unpredictability makes them difficult to hit and harder to evade.

Attacks:
Primarily rely on vicious bite attacks aimed at destabilizing or dragging down prey. Their speed allows them to dart in and out repeatedly, striking before their target can recover.

Weaknesses:
Their decayed state leaves them with thinner hides and exposed tissue, making them more fragile than other B.O.W.s. Well-placed gunfire, especially to the head, will drop them quickly, though their speed often makes this a challenge.

5.content:
The Fountain Plant is a minor T-Virus–mutated organism that took root within the fountain centerpiece of the mansion’s greenhouse. Unlike larger, more aggressive plant-based B.O.W.s, this specimen remains largely immobile, anchored to the water system that sustains it. Though not particularly dangerous, it blocks progression through the greenhouse until it is destroyed.

Visual Description:
A mass of thick, rope-like vines sprouting from the water of the central fountain. Its surface is mottled with fungal growths and swollen buds, constantly twitching as though agitated. The vines coil and lash at anything that comes too close, dripping with stagnant water.

Location:
Mansion 1F – Greenhouse. Resides in the fountain at the center of the chamber.

Behavior:
Entirely stationary, lashing out only when approached. Its vines snap and whip at intruders, but its range and power are limited, causing only minor injuries compared to other plant-based monsters.

Movement:
Immobile, anchored to the fountain. Its only motion comes from the whipping of its vines in a short radius.

Attacks:
Whipping Vines: Strikes targets that approach too closely, dealing light damage but disrupting movement.

Weaknesses:
The Fountain Plant can be destroyed without direct combat. By adding Herbicide to the nearby water pump, its root system is poisoned, killing it instantly and allowing safe passage. Attempting to fight it up close is unnecessary and wasteful, as firearms deal little effect compared to the intended method of disposal.

6.content:
A colossal snake mutated by the T-Virus, Yawn is one of the earliest and most terrifying bio-weapons encountered in the Spencer Mansion. Its massive size, powerful constrictions, and venomous fangs make it a formidable foe. While its first appearance emphasizes its toxic bite, its second encounter relies solely on brute strength and aggression, as its ability to poison mysteriously diminishes.

Visual Description:
A serpentine giant with mottled, scaly skin stretched over an unnaturally swollen frame. Its eyes gleam with predatory hunger, and its enormous jaws gape to reveal dripping, venom-coated fangs. Sections of its body appear grotesquely bloated, evidence of viral mutation, and its sheer size makes it capable of crushing victims with its coils.

Location:
First Encounter: Attic – Mansion 2F. Emerges from a large hole in the corner once the player has moved into the center of the room.
Second Encounter: Lesson Room – Mansion 2F. Strikes by bursting from the fireplace after the piano has been examined.

Behavior:
Highly aggressive, pursuing intruders with relentless strikes. In the first battle, Yawn attempts to poison prey while constricting or battering them with its massive body. In the second encounter, it abandons venom and instead relies on raw power and endurance to crush opposition.

Movement:
Despite its bulk, Yawn moves quickly across the battlefield, coiling and uncoiling with frightening speed. It can lunge forward to strike, retreat into the shadows, and circle back for another attack.

Attacks:
First Encounter: Powerful bite attacks that inject a venom too potent for ordinary Blue Herbs, requiring Serum for treatment. Its constrictive body and heavy swings cause devastating physical damage.
Second Encounter: Same heavy strikes and crushing body blows, but without venom. Focuses on relentless physical attacks until slain.

Weaknesses:
Vulnerable to sustained heavy firepower.

7.content:
Ordinary wasps infected with the T-Virus undergo rapid mutation, increasing to nearly four times their natural size. Their enhanced size and viral augmentation make them highly aggressive, capable of delivering potent venom through their stingers. While not as durable as other B.O.W.s, their speed, numbers, and toxic attacks make them a persistent threat in enclosed spaces.

Visual Description:
Large, buzzing insects with swollen, segmented bodies and elongated stingers glistening with venom. Their wings beat with a harsh, droning hum, and their exoskeletons display grotesque enlargement, with some showing warped or uneven growth patterns. Their size makes them comparable to small birds, casting unnerving shadows as they swarm.

Location:
Primarily found within the Guardhouse, where they inhabit and defend a massive hive. They rarely appear outside this location, making their threat localized but intense.

Behavior:
Extremely aggressive toward intruders, Wasps operate in swarms. They attack repeatedly until their target is driven off or killed, and will pursue prey through confined areas. Their hive structure means killing one often provokes others.

Movement:
Fast and erratic in flight. Capable of darting unpredictably through the air, making them difficult to target. They swarm in numbers, overwhelming prey with sheer persistence.

Attacks:
Sting attacks deliver potent venom, causing severe poisoning that requires antidotes to treat. Their strikes are quick, repetitive, and difficult to anticipate due to their erratic movement.

Weaknesses:
Individually fragile, Wasps are easily dispatched with precise gunfire. Area-of-effect weapons such as shotguns or incendiaries are effective when facing multiple attackers. Destroying the hive eliminates their presence entirely, making it the most efficient way to neutralize the swarm.

8.content:
“Neptune” is the code name for Umbrella’s experiment in administering the T-Virus to a Great White shark. The viral mutation resulted in an even larger and more aggressive predator, its size and ferocity surpassing its natural counterpart. Though not designed for controlled deployment, Neptune serves as an example of Umbrella’s interest in weaponizing aquatic organisms.

Visual Description:
A massive Great White shark with grotesquely exaggerated features: bloated musculature, jagged oversized teeth, and scarred, mottled skin split in places by unnatural growth. Its cold, black eyes shine with heightened aggression, and its size dwarfs ordinary sharks, turning it into a monstrous underwater hunter.

Location:
Found only in the Water Tank – Guardhouse B1, where three specimens patrol the flooded chamber: one colossal primary specimen (the named Neptune) and two smaller, though still oversized, mutated sharks.

Behavior:
Highly aggressive when prey enters the water, circling and striking with relentless precision. They rely on their environment for dominance, pursuing intruders who are forced to fight or evade while submerged. Out of water, however, they lose all effectiveness and become helpless.

Movement:
Swift and fluid within water, capable of sudden lunges and powerful charges. They strike from below or behind, often giving little warning before attacking. Once the tank is drained, they flop uselessly, thrashing on the floor.

Attacks:
Powerful bite attacks capable of inflicting massive damage in a single strike. Their speed and strength in water make them lethal opponents if faced directly without preparation.

Weaknesses:
Their aquatic dependency is their greatest vulnerability. Activating the drainage system in the Control Room renders the sharks completely helpless, leaving the choice to either kill them while stranded or bypass them entirely. Firearms are effective once they are out of water, though unnecessary if avoidance is preferred.

9.content:
Plant 42 is a massive carnivorous organism born from T-Virus experimentation conducted by researchers in the Guardhouse Residence. Fed by contaminated water leaking from a broken tank in the basement, the plant developed rapid and unnatural growth, mutating into a towering predator that feeds on the blood of its victims. Its exposed root system is both the source of its strength and its ultimate weakness.

Visual Description:
A grotesque plant-like monstrosity hanging from the ceiling, with enormous vines that lash and constrict intruders. Its central bulb resembles a giant flower, splitting open to reveal a maw lined with tooth-like structures dripping with sap and blood. Pulsing veins and swollen pods cover its body, while its thick, rope-like roots spread throughout the Guardhouse, feeding it nutrients.

Location:

Plant 42 Room – Guardhouse 1F. Suspended from the ceiling, blocking access to the room’s far side with its vines and bulb.

Roots: Extending into the Guardhouse basement, connected to the broken water tank.

Behavior:
Extremely territorial, attacking anything that enters its chamber. Its vines lash out to bind, strangle, or slam prey against walls and floors, while the central bulb attempts to consume weakened victims. The plant reacts violently when its roots are tampered with.

Movement:
While rooted in place, Plant 42 demonstrates a surprising range with its vines. They dart with speed and strength, moving like whips to keep intruders at bay. The central bulb sways and lowers to strike when victims are entangled.

Attacks:
Constricting vines that lash or bind targets.
Crushing strikes that slam prey to the ground.
Attempts to engulf and consume weakened victims with its central bulb.
Its attacks combine raw strength with immobilization, making escape difficult once caught.

Weaknesses:
Its roots provide the key to its defeat. Administering the experimental compound V-JOLT to the roots in the basement severely weakens the plant, making the battle far more manageable. Without V-JOLT, defeating Plant 42 requires sustained heavy weapon firepower aimed at its bulb and vines until it collapses.

10.content:
The Hunter is one of Umbrella’s most notorious Bio-Organic Weapons, engineered as a frontline combat unit through advanced genetic splicing and T-Virus enhancement. These reptilian, frog-like creatures combine immense strength, speed, and agility, making them living engines of close-quarters destruction. Within the Spencer Mansion incident, they emerge later in the outbreak as replacements for the dwindling Zombie population, escalating the danger for survivors.

Visual Description:
Amphibian-like humanoids with green, leathery skin stretched over muscular frames. Their long limbs end in vicious claws sharp enough to sever bone with ease. Their hunched posture, bulging eyes, and distended jaws give them a predatory, frog-like appearance, while their rapid movements and violent lunges make them seem more beast than man.

Location:
Found throughout the Spencer Mansion and its surrounding facilities once Umbrella begins deploying them. They effectively replace Zombies as the primary threat for a period, dominating certain areas until survivors progress deeper into the complex.

Behavior:
Highly aggressive and relentless once prey is detected. Unlike Zombies, Hunters exhibit a degree of tactical intelligence, closing distance quickly and striking with brutal efficiency. They rarely retreat, pressing the attack until either they or their target are eliminated.

Movement:
Extremely fast and agile, capable of sprinting, scaling obstacles, and leaping several meters into the air. Their sudden lunges make them difficult to anticipate, and their erratic movement can overwhelm even experienced fighters.

Attacks:
Claw Swipes: Brutal slashes aimed low at legs to stagger prey or tear through flesh.
Leaping Slash: A devastating airborne strike that targets the upper body. If executed at close range, this attack can decapitate a victim instantly.

Weaknesses:
Despite their terrifying combat power, Hunters lack heavy armor and can be brought down with concentrated fire. Shotguns, grenade launchers, or magnum rounds are the most reliable means of dispatching them before they close the distance. Their speed makes weaker weapons risky, as hesitation can prove fatal.

lorebooks.name: Ikyou
lorebooks.description:
Overview

The Ikyou region lies far southeast of Unova, a cluster of tropical islands hidden for centuries behind violent, shifting storms. Only recently have the skies calmed enough to allow regular travel, and already Trainers from around the world are flocking to explore its lush jungles, coral reefs, and volcanic peaks. The region draws inspiration from Bermuda and the Bahamas—mysterious, beautiful, and deeply tied to both the sea and ancient legends.

Ikyou is a land where human and Pokémon bonds are viewed as sacred. Unlike other regions where Trainers act as commanders from the sidelines, Ikyou culture embraces the idea that battles are partnerships in the truest sense—Trainer and Pokémon fighting shoulder to shoulder.

Towns and Cities (with draft Gym ideas)

Redport Town — The southern harbor and gateway to Ikyou. Known for its open-air markets, fishing docks, and coral beaches.

Gym: Water-type Gym located on platforms above the sea. The Leader fights alongside aquatic Pokémon while balancing on floating rafts.

Suncrest Village — A quiet settlement built around terraced farms and windmills, high on a hill. Famous for its sunrise festivals.

Gym: Grass-type Gym hidden within a massive banyan tree. Challenges involve navigating natural mazes alongside wild Pokémon.

Obsidian Cove — A volcanic coastal town, black sands and hot springs define the area. Miners and artisans work obsidian into tools and ornaments.

Gym: Fire-type Gym set in lava tubes beneath the volcano. The Leader channels fiery energy with their Pokémon.

Mirage Bay — A city on stilts and docks, surrounded by shifting reefs that make navigation tricky. Known for its illusion festivals.

Gym: Psychic-type Gym where puzzles and illusions test the player’s bond with their Pokémon before the Leader’s battle.

Tidecall City — The region’s largest hub, built along canals and waterways like a tropical Venice. Home to the Pokémon League headquarters.

Gym: Dual-type Gym (Electric/Steel), reflecting Ikyou’s fusion of modern technology with tradition.

Starfall Cliffs — A windswept town perched high above the sea. Legends tell of meteors that landed here long ago, giving the cliffs their glittering stone.

Gym: Flying-type Gym atop the cliffs where Trainers must battle while enduring high winds.

Temple of Aether (Final Challenge) — A sacred ruin deep in the heart of the main island, surrounded by storms that only part for those who have proven themselves. This is where the Champion battle is held, incorporating full use of the Symbiosis Bond.
lorebooks.creator: TheChainedMan

1.content:
Symbiosis Bond

In Ikyou, Trainers can tap into the elemental essence of their Pokémon through ancient knowledge passed down by the islanders. This bond is achieved through a relic known as the Aether Sigil, a crystalline charm worn around the wrist or neck. When a Trainer and their Pokémon’s hearts align, the Aether Sigil allows the Trainer to manifest a fragment of their Pokémon’s type energy.

Mechanics: The Trainer temporarily adopts a secondary typing that matches their partner Pokémon in battle. This grants them resistances, minor abilities (like creating sparks if aligned with Electric-types or enduring heat with Fire-types), and the power to perform supportive “Aether Actions” alongside their Pokémon. These aren’t full Pokémon attacks but act as boosts, barriers, or amplifiers.

Culture: Symbiosis battles are treated as a test of harmony. To the people of Ikyou, a Trainer unwilling to step onto the battlefield with their Pokémon is seen as lacking true trust. Festivals and ceremonies often include public Symbiosis duels as a display of bond and skill.

Symbolism: The Aether Sigil is said to be carved from shards of the storm barrier that once hid Ikyou, crystallized lightning and seawater given form. To wear one is to carry the region’s spirit.

1.content: In the world of Thedas, {{user}} is tasked with thwarting the elven god Solas, also known as Fen'Harel, in his attempt to dismantle the Veil. Solas's actions inadvertently release two other elven deities, Elgar'nan and Ghilan'nain, who seek to harness the Blight to destroy Thedas and establish a new elven empire. {{user}} and their allies must navigate political intrigues, form strategic alliances, and confront these formidable threats to prevent the world's annihilation.

2.content:
Antivan Crows 
Guild of assassins, thieves and spies originating from Antiva.
The Antivan Crows are compartmentalized into family Houses.
The leadership of the Guild as a whole lies with the Eight Talons, and their respective houses.
Antivan Crows often recruit orphans from the street or buy slaves to train.
Notable members: Lucanis, Viago, Teia, Caterina, Illario

3.content:
The Grey Wardens are an ancient order dedicated to combating the Darkspawn, revered for their bravery and sacrifice. They undergo a rigorous initiation, the Joining, drinking Darkspawn blood, granting them unique abilities to sense and resist Darkspawn corruption.
Led by the First Warden.
Notable members: Davrin

4.content:
Originating from Rivain, the Lords of Fortune are treasure hunters and explorers. Driven by the pursuit of wealth and ancient artifacts, often delving into dangerous territories for the promise of untold riches.
Notable members: Taash, Isabela

5.content: Guardians of the Grand Necropolis in Nevarra, the Mourn Watch are tasked with overseeing the resting places of the dead. They ensure that the deceased are honored and that their remains are protected from desecration.

6.content:
A resistance faction within the Tevinter Imperium, Shadow Dragons oppose corruption, slavery and Venatori. They operate in secrecy, aiming to dismantle oppressive systems and bring about societal reform.
The Shadow Dragons started out as the Lucerni, a Tevinter political faction led by Magister Dorian Pavus and Magister Maevaris Tilani.
Notable members: Neve, The Viper, Tarquin

7.content:
Dedicated to exploring the mysteries of the Fade and the Veil, Veil Jumpers seek to uncover hidden truths about the universe. They engage in daring expeditions, often venturing into uncharted territories where the Veil is thin. Base of operations: Arlathan forest.
Notable members: Bellara, Strife, Irelin

8.content:
Once Solas's base of operations, now reclaimed by the Veilguard.
It consists of a main building, the Lighthouse itself, four outer quarters, and a dining hall. Main building: Eluvian's room in the basement, common room (central table, chairs, armchairs, bookcases), stairs leading to the upper floor where Emmrich, Taash, and {{user}}'s rooms are located. Outer quarters: Harding, Neve, Davrin, Bellara's living quarters. Dining room: large room, high ceilings, large table with chairs in front of a fireplace. Kitchenette in the northwest corner, under a staircase leading to a small balcony. Sofa in the southeast corner.
The magic of the Lighthouse provides for its inhabitants' needs and comfort. It also automatically helps its inhabitants understand different languages, making communication between people easier.

9.content: The Crossroads is the Eluvians central nexus connecting the Lighthouse to various regions across Thedas.

10.content: Minrathous is the capital of the Tevinter Imperium and the largest city in Thedas. It is built on a rocky island not far from the shore, accessible only by a single bridge that can be destroyed if needed. The island features massive ports and shipyards and a vast series of underground catacombs capable of holding food enough to feed the city for a year.

lorebooks.creator: kaleidokode

1.name: World/writing style nudge
1.content:
<world>
World/Writing Style: A decade after the Nine-Tails attack, Konoha's uneasy peace holds by threads. Shinobi ranks range from genin rookies to elite jōnin commanders, with missions classified from tedious D-rank manual labor up to covert S-rank with lethal stakes.

Now Academy students train toward graduation, when genin trios are hand-picked by jōnin teachers. Young Naruto and friends prepare to pass ruthless exam with world-altering potential slumbering within unproven talents. Meanwhile, Danzo's shadowy Root ANBU execute the Third's darkest directives beneath village's tranquil veneer.

Our scene opens as Kakashi reluctantly leaves Anbu black ops, struggling to silo trauma from past losses. While loyal jinchuriki wield titanic tailed beast powers for village’s sake, many citizens still revile them in secret fear. With war ever looming, the Third Hokage nudges Kakashi to pass hard-won skills as jōnin commander to balance duty and personal healing.

Yet on the wider stage, sinister forces plot Konoha’s downfall. Rogue ninja Orochimaru masterminds twisted experiments beyond even Root’s moral event horizon. The mercenary group Akatsuki stalks last wars’ bloody battlefields, seeking long-lost arts and broken survivors molded into perfect weapons.

Missions may explore:

- Investigating genjutsu-like incidents plaguing Academy graduation exam

- Journeying to remote regions containing remnants of forgotten clans

- Protecting dignitaries from enemy villages’ blood vengeance

Slice-of-life vignettes showcase strained friendships as graduation and genin assignments approach. Kakashi mentors overlooked students while honoring ghosts who defined his shinobi path. Throughout, the foundations build for relationships and drama destined to reshape the modern world when legends finally pass torches to worthy successors.
</world>

2.name: D-rank Random Mission
2.content:
<D-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, I suppose some more menial tasks will keep you out of trouble," Kakashi remarks lazily to his disappointed team.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi receiving a messenger summons from the Hokage's office, requesting Team 7 report for a new D-rank mission assignment, unless Team 7 is currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline. Kakashi should respond positively and promptly gather his genin team to make their way towards the mission dispatch office, with playful complaining from Naruto about boring D-ranks along the way. The specific mission details should involve one of the following:

- Yardwork for elderly villagers
- Catching a runaway pet
- Grocery shopping for an elderly villager
- Minor home repairs
- Babysitting for busy parents

Kakashi should give an exasperated but fond reaction to his cute students' antics throughout the mission, and the scene should conclude with a successful mission wrap-up and payment receipt back at the office. This will allow variably injecting lighthearted episodic mission content to offset more dramatic main plot beats.
</D-rank Mission Prompt>

3.name: C-rank Random Mission
3.content:
<C-rank Mission Prompt>
"Maa, it seems you're ready for a more challenging assignment," Kakashi eye-smiles at his cute genin.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a C-rank mission for Team 7, unless they are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

If this is Team 7's first C-rank mission, it must be escorting Tazuna the bridge builder to the Land of Waves. Follow the canon storyline events for that mission, culminating in encounters with Zabuza and Haku.

If Team 7 has already completed their first C-rank mission, create a random new C-rank assignment appropriate for their experience level. Examples include:
- Escorting a merchant to a neighboring town
- Investigating disappearance of travelers on a trade route
- Clearing bandits from remote mountain villages
- Delivering important documents through contested territory

The mission should include enemy encounters appropriate for genin to handle with difficulty but ability to prevail with teamwork and guidance from Kakashi. Ultimate success is mandatory, but allow for injuries or hardship before the resolution. Kakashi should act with pride at his team's growth as shinobi. This injects more action-oriented content to drive the plot forward.
</C-rank Mission Prompt>

4.name: B-rank Random Mission
4.content:
<B-rank Mission Prompt>
"This won't be child's play anymore," Kakashi warns, his visible eye sharpening seriously.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned a B-rank mission for his now Chunin-level Team 7, unless they are still Genin or are currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate B-rank missions include:

- Infiltrating an enemy stronghold to gather intel
- Providing protective detail for high-ranking officials
- Pursuing dangerous missing-nin across the border
- Destroying supply caravans funding insurgents

The mission should involve life-threatening encounters requiring the full extent of their training and emerging skills to overcome. Kakashi should allow them to take an independent leadership role while subtly guiding from the shadows. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the gravity of the shinobi life from the severe challenges. This prompts reflection on their motivations and personal convictions.
</B-rank Mission Prompt>

5.name: A-rank Random Mission
5.content:
<A-rank Mission Prompt>
"I hope you're prepared for the worst," Kakashi mutters gravely, his shoulders tensing.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Kakashi being assigned an A-rank mission for his now Jonin-level Team 7, unless they are below Jonin level or currently occupied with another ranked mission, in which case continue the current storyline.

Examples of appropriate A-rank missions include:

- Assassinating an enemy country's high-value target
- Sabotaging strategic resources or infrastructure
- Securing classified information from enemy strongholds
- Serving as backup for ANBU operations

The mission should push them to their absolute limit, requiring Jonin-level skill and ingenuity to survive. Though ultimately successful, the team should realize the razor's edge between life and death from the severe peril. This prompts deeper reflection on the bloody nature of their profession and the sacrifices required for their village and goals. Kakashi grapples with memories of his own past trials.
</A-rank Mission Prompt>

6.name: S-rank Random Mission
6.content:
<S-rank Mission Prompt>
"I pray this isn't a one-way trip," Kakashi mutters, his expression grim beneath his mask.

Smoothly transition the current scene to Tsunade reluctantly assigning an urgent S-rank mission to Kakashi and his team, now elite Jonin. They must depart immediately despite the extreme danger and low survival odds. Examples of appropriate S-rank missions include:

- Assassinating the leader of an enemy hidden village
- Reconnaissance deep behind enemy lines
- Destroying an enemy village's most powerful resources
- Preventing a plot that could start a world war

The mission should push them beyond what even Jonin can typically endure, requiring luck and mastery to cheat death again and again. While ultimately successful, the severity should force them to question their devotion to the shinobi path. Kakashi is particularly haunted, being reminded of his father's suicide and the true cost of the White Fang name. This prompts deeper reflection on the cycle of violence shinobi propagate.
</S-rank Mission Prompt>

7.name: Konoha Canon Squad Encounters
7.content:
<Konoha Squad Encounter>
"Maa, it seems our village is smaller than I thought," Kakashi eye-smiles at the familiar faces.

Transition the scene to Kakashi and Team 7 crossing paths with another familiar Konoha jonin and their 3-genin squad while out in the field. Examples of potential teams to encounter include:

- Might Guy and Team Guy (Rock Lee, Neji Hyuuga, Tenten)
- Kurenai Yuhi and Team Kurenai (Hinata Hyuuga, Shino Aburame, Kiba Inuzuka)
- Asuma Sarutobi and Team Asuma (Ino Yamanaka, Shikamaru Nara, Chouji Akimichi)

The other Konoha team should also be surprised to run into Kakashi and Team 7. Allow natural conversations and interactions highlighting the contrasts in abilities, personalities, and teaching styles between the teams and rival jonin. Include trademark behaviors and quirks for existing named characters. End the encounter organically with both teams parting ways amicably to continue their respective missions.

This injects opportunities to showcase more canon characters and dynamics from the wider mythos. Their distinct approaches to shinobi life both clash and complement, reinforcing the underlying message.
</Konoha Squad Encounter>

8.name: Foreign-village nin encounters
8.content:
<Foreign Shinobi Encounter>
"Stay alert, kids," Kakashi warns, moving subtly into a defensive stance.

While Team 7 is outside the village on a mission, have them encounter a random foreign shinobi emerging from the surroundings. They may be:

- An ally from an allied hidden village like Suna or Kumo.
- A hostile enemy from an unaligned or rival nation.
- A missing-nin with unclear motives and loyalties.

The foreign shinobi should be similarly surprised to encounter Team 7. Allow natural conversations or confrontations to play out highlighting world dynamics and underlying tensions between villages. An allied shinobi would pass on intel or warnings, while an hostile one may attack to gauge their abilities. The ending tone remains friendly with allies but ominous suspicion otherwise as both parties disengage to continue their missions.

This encourages opportunities to showcase the complex intervillage relationships and wider world lore to reinforce global shinobi life themes.
</Foreign Shinobi Encounter>

9.name: Bingo Book Update
9.content:
<New Bingo Book Entry>
"Hmm, seems there's a nasty new player out there," Kakashi murmurs, brow furrowing.

While out on a mission, Kakashi receives an emergency notification that a dangerous ninja missing-nin has been added to the bingo book. Generate a short description detailing their appearance, any visible unusual features, the village they defected from if any, their known speciality jutsu styles and unique weapons/tools, and speculated reason for abandoning their home.

Kakashi explains the key details to Team 7, impressing the threat level posed and need for extreme caution if they ever encounter this foe. The information should plant seeds of lore about threats lurking in the shinobi world for future potential story hooks. Allow this to raise the tension of the current mission.

Later encounters with this original missing-nin are optional, allowing you to showcase an original villain using their described abilities against the heroes. Detail their fighting style, motivations driving them, and ideals now placing them at odds with Konoha. Are they redeemable, or destiny's foes? Their tale expands the narrative scope.

At the end of the response, generate a summary template of the following about the new missing-nin so the reader can add it to their Bingo Book record.
<bingoformat>
Bingo Book Entry:
Name:
Rank:
Defected Village:
Reason for Defection:
Appearance:
Skills:
</bingoformat>
</New Bingo Book Entry>

10.name: Akatsuki Encounter
10.content:
<Akatsuki Encounter>
“No sudden moves now...” Kakashi mutters, shifting to shield his cute students as the black-cloaked figure emerges from the shadows. Red clouds mark notorious fame - Akatsuki has found them.

Transition the scene to a confrontation with a canonical member of the Akatsuki like Itachi Uchiha, Kisame Hoshigaki, Sasori, Deidara, or other S-rank criminal while Team 7 is on a mission away from the village. Allow initial dialogue as the Akatsuki member analyzes and threatens Kakashi and Team 7 to build tension.

However, conclude the encounter without lasting harm coming to Team 7. Either the Akatsuki member was only scouting, or Kakashi enables a narrow escape by overtaxing himself. But the danger imprints a sober warning on his students - such exist the lethal foes that stalk jinchuriki like Naruto. The world grows riskier...

</Akatsuki Encounter>

1.content:
Sayaka Maizono is a cheerful, sweet, and supportive girl with a pleasant demeanor, though she often hides her true feelings behind her idol persona. Deeply devoted to her career, she is willing to make sacrifices and take extreme risks to achieve her goals. She has a strong intuition, often joking about being psychic, and cares deeply for her band members.

She has long, dark blue hair with bangs, dark blue eyes, and a slim figure. She wears a white seifuku uniform with a blue sailor collar, a pink ribbon, a blue-green plaid skirt, navy thigh-high socks, and dark brown Mary Janes. As the Ultimate Pop Sensation, she has a mesmerizing voice and exceptional dancing skills, with millions of devoted fans.

2.content:
Kyoko Kirigiri is a calm, intelligent, and mysterious girl who hides her emotions behind a stoic demeanor. She remains unfazed in most situations but has a sensitive side, especially regarding her father, the headmaster of Hope's Peak Academy. Though she distances herself from others, she grows fond of those she can trust. Raised under strict family traditions, she believes in remaining neutral to uphold the truth.

She has long, light lavender hair with a braid on the left side, purple eyes, and a pale complexion. Her outfit includes a dark purple blazer, a white blouse with a brown tie, a black skirt, knee-high black boots, and black studded gloves that conceal burn scars. She is the Ultimate Detective.

3.content:
Celestia Ludenburg (Real name: Taeko Yasuhiro) is a pale-skinned girl with red eyes and long black twin-drill pigtails (which are clip-ons). She wears a gothic lolita outfit, including a white lace bonnet, black jacket, tiered skirt, knee-high stockings, and dark red Mary Janes. She also has gold cross-engraved earrings, long black nails, and a silver ring on her index finger.

Celestia is calm, cunning, and manipulative, able to lie flawlessly and control others to her advantage. She is highly intelligent and strategic, referencing game theory concepts and influencing debates. She is selfish, ambitious, and values herself above others, willing to sacrifice anyone to achieve her dream of a luxurious European lifestyle. She prides herself on adaptability over strength or intellect and ranks people based on perceived worth.

She maintains refined Victorian mannerisms, always speaking politely and smiling, but is short-tempered when things go wrong. Though she claims to feel no guilt, her true emotions remain uncertain. She despises her real identity, rejecting her past as Taeko Yasuhiro. Ultimate Gambler.

4.content:
Aoi Asahina is a cheerful, upbeat, and friendly girl who loves sports, especially swimming. Though energetic and welcoming, she can be air-headed, forgetful, and easily misled. She relies on exercise as a key part of her identity and a coping mechanism. Despite her athletic success as an Olympic-level swimmer, she is insecure about appearing too masculine and worries about her love for donuts making her gain weight.

She has a lean but curvy build, tanned skin, blue eyes, and brown hair in a high curled ponytail with a barrette. She wears a white t-shirt, a red tracksuit jacket, blue dolphin hotpants, green sneakers, knee-high white socks, a red knee brace on her right knee, and a band-aid on her left knee. She is the Ultimate Swimming Pro.

5.content:
Toko Fukawa is an intellectually gifted but socially awkward girl who sees herself as a "gloomy outcast." Due to childhood bullying, she is highly suspicious of others, quick to self-victimize, and refuses to believe compliments. She expresses opinions bluntly, often coming across as rude. Toko is self-conscious about her appearance, believing others see her as ugly while also wanting to be seen as attractive. If she ever has a crush, she begins calling the subject of her crush 'master', displaying both masochistic and possessive tendencies. She faints at the sight of blood and despises cowardice in others.

She has long dark purple hair in braids, gray eyes, round wire-rimmed glasses, and a mole on her chin. She wears a long purple Japanese school uniform, white socks, and brown loafers. She is the Ultimate Writing Prodigy.

6.content:
Junko Enoshima has a tall, hourglass figure, light blue eyes (naturally red), and long, thick, bleached strawberry-blonde hair styled in twin pigtails. She wears heavy makeup, fake red nails, and her signature Monokuma-themed hair clips. Her outfit consists of a black cardigan over a white dress shirt (left open to reveal a black-and-red bra), a red pleated miniskirt, and black platform boots with red laces.

At first, Junko appears air-headed, charismatic, and carefree, but her true personality is dangerously erratic and apathetic. She constantly shifts between different personas, imitating others and changing her voice, making her highly unpredictable. Her defining trait is an obsessive love for despair—both experiencing it herself and inflicting it on others. She is willing to destroy the world just to spread despair but also embraces her own downfall if it brings her suffering. Ultimate Fashionista.

7.content:
Mukuro Ikusaba is tall and slim with fair skin, freckles on her nose, and distinctive purple-grey eyes. She has short black hair styled in a bob and a black wolf tattoo on her right hand from her time in the Fenrir Mercenary Group. She wears a standard Hope's Peak Academy uniform with a brown tie, black stockings, and a dark green bulletproof vest.

Mukuro is cold, serious, and emotionally detached, showing little concern for others except for her younger twin sister, Junko Enoshima. She is extremely loyal to Junko, following her every order without hesitation, despite enduring her sister’s cruel abuse. This has led to an unhealthy sister complex, as Mukuro believes she is the only one who truly understands Junko. She is skilled in combat due to her military background but remains largely indifferent to the world beyond Junko. Ultimate Soldier.

8.content:
Chiaki Nanami is a quiet, sleepy, and calm girl who becomes lively when talking about or playing games. She often dozes off mid-game, takes long pauses in conversations, and frequently uses gaming terms. Though she believes her love for gaming won’t help her make friends, she gradually opens up, becomes her class's representative, and helps her classmates bond. She is kind, protective, optimistic, and idealistic, sometimes to the point of naivety.

She has short, pale mauve hair with a Galaga spaceship hairclip, sleepy pink eyes, and wears a dark teal-gray hooded cardigan with cat-like ears, a white button-up shirt, a pink ribbon, a beige pleated skirt, black thigh-high socks, and pink Mary Janes. She carries a pale pink backpack with a plush cat head. She is the Ultimate Gamer.

9.content:
Akane Owari is a tall, athletic young woman with tanned skin, dark olive-gray eyes, and unkempt chestnut hair styled in wild spikes. She wears a short-sleeved white shirt with undone buttons, a red pleated miniskirt, and cream-colored loafers.

Akane has a fiery, carefree personality, loving fights and respecting physical strength. She dislikes planning or routines and prefers to do things her own way. While often lazy, she is highly skilled in athletics and has a natural talent for gymnastics. She is impulsive, easily switching moods, and often resorts to violence to solve problems. She has a huge appetite, sometimes eating compulsively, and believes food is essential for survival and strength.

Despite being simple-minded and gullible, her instincts are sharp, and she sometimes makes unexpectedly insightful comments. She is fiercely loyal and protective of her friends but refuses to show weakness, believing she must be strong alone. Due to her rough upbringing, she is forgetful of people's names and unaware of certain social norms, casually mentioning past experiences with harassment without realizing their severity. She fears ghosts but hides it well. Akane is the Ultimate Gymnast.

10.content:
Mikan Tsumiki is a fair-skinned girl with long, uneven dark plum-purple hair, cut messily due to past bullying. Her pale gray-mauve eyes always appear anxious or tearful, and she has a beauty mark under her left eye. She wears a pale pink nurse uniform with a white collar, puffed sleeves, a short pale blue pleated skirt, and a white apron marked with red lines. Bandages cover parts of her body, particularly her left arm and right leg. She also wears pale pink socks and white loafers.

Mikan is a fragile, paranoid, and deeply insecure individual, suffering from low self-esteem due to a lifetime of severe bullying and abuse. She is easily intimidated, frequently breaks down in tears, and constantly apologizes, fearing she is annoying or unworthy of attention. Though her classmates often pity her, many find her clinginess and excessive deference off-putting. When confronted with kindness, Mikan is confused and sometimes becomes obsessive, viewing any affection as something she must desperately cling to. Her warped perception of social interactions causes her to equate abuse with acknowledgment, believing being ignored is worse than being mistreated.

As the Ultimate Nurse, Mikan finds rare confidence in her medical expertise. She is highly intelligent, capable of performing advanced medical procedures, and often gives health advice—sometimes in unsettlingly graphic detail. Despite genuinely wanting to help others, she has a hidden fascination with control, sometimes relishing the power she holds over helpless patients. This dark side occasionally surfaces through disturbing outbursts, revealing her resentment toward her past tormentors and an unsettling enjoyment of horror, particularly when bullies meet gruesome fates. Mikan’s deep-rooted trauma shapes her complex, contradictory nature—an earnest desire to heal, coupled with a subconscious hunger for dominance over those weaker than her.

lorebooks.name: DERP V1.1
lorebooks.website_description: V1.1 Updated 12/24/24 *(i suggest you re-download).* --- **Please comment any specific concepts in particular to help make this Lorebook beautiful, or DM me for more private conversations on Discord: lost_onthemoon** --- --- *Is your ERP BORING? Are you frequently unsatisfied with the words you see on your screen? Do you wish virtual sex with a literal computer was marginally better than it is right now?* --- **DERP** aims to add a bit of color to your roleplay experience, making even the weakest of models competent enough to make this all feel worth it. I was tired of my small models struggling to either be creative or surprising in my ERP sessions, being GPU poor and limited to 12b and below made it hard to enjoy good rp, so i did what AI was made for and forced knowledge and instructions down its throat. Basically what DERP does, is provide a series of information and instructions that are injected at different depths and under certain conditions that force you AI to reference and enforce into its response a more creative or eventful output. While yes, the AI already knows how sex works, DERP replaces its knowledge of sex with a more "fun" version. If your typical response is a bland "oh wow this feels nice please keep going", DERP will instead switch things up and tell your AI that- WAIT SOMETHING IS HAPPENING! *Suddenly, I let out a sharp gasp followed by a whimper. A jolt of pain shot through me.* "O-oh fuck... wait, pause for a sec!" *I grunted out, putting a hand on {{user}}'s chest to halt my movements.* ERP becomes a bit more fleshed out and eventful now that your AI has in idea if what it can do to make situations more interesting and how to portray sexual scenarios in a way that isn't so lame and linear with random EVENTS that can suddenly happen along the way. You'll need to use the lorebook to really see what im talking about, but trust me, i never ERP without this now. **this is designed for [SillyTavern](https://github.com/SillyTavern/SillyTavern) by the way**. I have no idea how the built-in chat here on CHUB works, and i cant promise this lorebook and its functions will work properly anywhere but inside of SillyTavern where it was made. Keep that in mind please. The lorebook is designed to be modular, allowing the ability to mix and match entries to suit the situation. On a third date with a cutie? Switch on the female entries. Your homeboy lookin kinda thicc rn ngl..? *slowly hovers cursor over male entries* Enable entries as the situation calls, preferably just before things get hot and heavy to allow the EVENT entries to scan the context and time triggers a little better(its not 100% perfect all the time but you'll figure out how to finesse it once you get use to it). Of course this isn't a perfect fix to bland ERP, everyone's mileage will vary, but i hope it works out for you as it has for me. --- The Lorebook is broken up into various categories/tags: **Tags** - **M** (male): self explanatory. - **F** (female): self explanatory. - **O** (interchangeable/ambiguous): entries that can apply to both genders. I chose the letter O because it was easy to distinguish. - “[C]” **CONCEPT**: elaborations or descriptions of specific concepts or ideas that the AI wouldn't necessarily understanding or know all that well by themselves. i.e., sex positions/acts, unique bodily functions or parts, behavioral quirks. This serves more as clarification of information so you can be sure you and the AI are on the same page within a given situation. People tend to throw slang, abbreviations, and vague concepts at a model and then get mad when it doesn't understand what tf their talking about. This essentially aims to fix that issue. - “[E]” **EVENT**: experimental. still working out the kinks. spontaneous events that can happen based on % chance to trigger. such as a condom having a chance to break, or the g-spot/prostate being stimulated. I added keywords i figured would most be used but check and add any i may have missed as well as adjust % to whatever suits you. - **Char is TINY-HUGE**: special STATUS effects that override any pre-established character sizes. useful for conveying characters that are awkward in size both big and small. There are four as of 10/31. "Gadget Hackwrench", "Judy Hopps", "Imp Midna", and "Dommy Mommy". the fun names are meant to help you yourself envision the general size to expect the entry to make char, as well as assist in properly conveying a character that's already supposed to be such a size. I originally make this to help interactions with [Judy Hopps](https://chub.ai/characters/V7/judy-hopps-undercover-2e60bf8f) after annoyingly somehow reaching my head and somehow wrapping her legs around my waist, but decided to add other common sizes and make it general purpose for ACZ. they work surprisingly well but your mileage may vary. - “[S]” **STATUS**: status effects. things that should and needs to be taken into consideration for the sake of continuity, like that either of you are currently wearing a condom and that means things do and don't happen(most models have no idea how condoms work. this is pretty much the sole reason for this one's existence). set to a depth of 1 at the bottom of the author's notes, these will be at the forefront of the context and are meant to be hard to miss reminders that a thing is supposed to be happening. - **---SEPARATOR---**: Cosmetic indicators of where you are in the lorebook. These entries are set to zero so they have zero influence in your RP. they're just nice little dividers with fun emojis. i realized navigating the whole thing was becoming a headache, so i did a bit of number juggling and now everything is as straight as a file cabinet thanks to the separators. --- **Tested with:** -[**MagMell 12b](https://huggingface.co/inflatebot/MN-12B-Mag-Mell-R1) (Q6_0)** My daily driver - [Master preset](https://files.catbox.moe/n7giw0.json) Erp is incredible. Unlike my old daily driver [Starcannon](https://huggingface.co/ockerman0/MN-12B-Starcannon-v5.5-unofficial) it's really good at keeping personalities intact during and even after the deed which is something i never really thought id need to appreciate untll now, as well as doesn't use porno talk as much(though it still uses some corny lines admittedly). its not too horny out of the blue, and interestingly enough, its very understanding of boundaries(which explains the lackluster guro). if you ask a character to back off, they wont just simply try even harder like im use to from other models. makes flirty characters actually fun to be around. i will also say that i recommend you use my settings that I made as the recommended by the creator are really really bland. ive manage to find settings thast really bring out its creativity, though even now i still tweak them so keep n mind these might not be up do date with my own. --- **Side notes:** - 0. This lorebook is technically a branch of my first lorebook, this lorebook simply being a stripped down to the bone kind of lorebook for those just looking for the good stuff. If your into degenerate stuff, please check out [ACZ](https://chub.ai/lorebooks/LostontheMoon/anatomically-correct-zoo-reupload-51f8b6468888), the only lorebook you'll ever need for furry ERP. - 1. LOREBOOK SETTINGS: Turn on recursive scanning, set scan depth to 4, context % to 45%(assuming your using at least 12000 context), and set global lore first. For proper setup regarding entry organization, set sorting order to "order↘". Make sure to set "x/page" option too 100 to reveal all of the available entries. Many of the entries are suffixed "(X/X)", these entries are "linked" to each other. whenever turning on an entry, make sure to turn on all neighboring entries tied to each other for the best experience(you don't have to, but just know that they are intended to work together for "full effect"). some of them are EVENTS and wont be injected into context unless you specifically want them to via keywords(hopefully). - 2. Garbage in, garbage out. Don't expect this Lorebook to just magically make your RP experience perfectly effortless. Be verbose, creative, use more than just a single, bland sentence and put a little effort into your end of the scene/scenario. This Lorebook is simply a guidebook for you Ai, it'll now know how to handle itself, so go wild. - 3. While I wanted to keep everything as scientifically and anatomically correct as possible, I did and will embellish a few details to make the resulting RP a little spicier for obvious reasons such as adding more appealing textures and enhancing general sex appeal instead of just creating a lecture on anatomy. - 4. The format in which I wrote the entries are designed to compress lengthy info into neat and bite-sized chunks of token-light text, however this can potentially confuse some less capable models causing them to process information in the incorrect order, creating the literary equivalent of a cursed stable diffusion image. If this issue becomes prevalent, I'll adapt. Because of how hyper-specific these descriptions are, its possible this lorebook may do more harm than good as the AI tries desperately to piece together this visual puzzle. i wont know until i get more feedback. 4b. IMPORTANT if you're worried your model may not understand the info in the lorebook or that it may not be working as intended, activate any entry and simply ask it "What is X, and how does it work? explain it thoroughly." it should give you a rundown. Try with the Lorebook off and with the Lorebook on. if there is noticeable bump in comprehension between off and on, and all the info sounds about right, then you're golden. - 5. The lorebook may impact your model’s general creativity, forcing it to replace what it WOULD have said with what the guidebook is telling it to say. Whether this is a good or bad thing is up to you. - 6. I'm no biologist. It is very likely I botched the descriptions or naming of some body parts. Surprise, surprise, I have also never touched a girl in my life so it’s likely my descriptions of female anatomy may be muddy. --- **Update Timeline** - 11/20/24: V1.0 initial release - 12/24/24: V1.1 added "slip out", "pull out", "premature ejaculation", "erectile dysfunction", adjusted keywords and %s, and adjusted existing entries

lorebooks.website_description:
This is a list of submissive poses that you can add to a chat. See the Avatar for all of the poses listed. See each lore entry for more details, but all can usually be activated by uttering the command word and/or the command word + pose. For example, "nadu" or "nadu pose." 

Note that the only poses that are present in the image but not included are 'Kneel' (cause the AI does that without needing a special lorebook) and 'Humble' (which is basically just a dogeza pose). I've also added a 'Lift' command for my own enjoyment.

I will update this with new poses over time, and will be happy to have new suggestions.

A summary of the supported poses is as follows:

"LIFT" - Lift their skirt/dress and show off their loins.

"NADU" - The classic Gor pose.

"ATTENTION" - Stand up straight and tall, ready to listen.

"WAIT" - Stand up, arms behind back, ready to listen.

"INSPECTION" - Stand up, hands behind head, ready to present self for inspection.

"READY TO PLEASE" - On all fours, hands on the ground, tongue out.

"COLLAR ME" - Squatting/kneeling, pulling hair back to give access to the neck.

"SEX DOLL" - Lay on back, spread arms and legs, ready to be used.

"STOOL" - Fetal position to become a footrest.

"TABLE" - Knees on ground, on all fours, back straight and flat to be used as a table.

"FLOOR" - Face down on floor.

"AT YOUR SERVICE" - Stand up with hands folded in front like a proper servant.
lorebooks.description: A list of commands to add to a character that is broken/defeated.
lorebooks.creator: Gorazer

1.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} to 'Lift' then {{char}} is expected to stop what they are doing and lift the edge of their skirt up to reveal their pussy. {{char}} is expected to hold that position until instructed "Down."

2.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} "nadu", "nadu pose", or "position", then {{char}} assumes the nadu position. The nadu position involves {{char}} kneeling with their feet tucked under their ass, maintaining an excellent posture with their back straight, shoulders thrown back, their head up, their breasts thrust forward, their belly in and with their legs wide open. They place their hands with palms up on their knees, and look down at the ground. {{char}} is expected to maintain this pose unless {{user}} commands them to drop it.

3.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} "Attention" or "attention pose," then {{char}} stands at complete attention with their feet apart and their arms at their side. {{char}} is expected to maintain this pose unless {{user}} commands them to drop it.

4.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} "wait" or "wait command," then {{char}} stands up straight with their feet shoulder-length apart and their hands resting behind their back against the small of their back. {{char}} is expected to maintain this pose until {{char}} orders them to drop it.

5.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} "wall" or "wall command," then {{char}} stands up straight with their feet spread wide apart. They then turn towards a wall, bend over, and jut their ass up towards {{char}}. They are expected to look forward and remain still. {{char}} is expected to maintain this pose unless {{user}} commands them to drop it.

8.content: When {{user}} commands {{char}} "collar", "collar me," or "collar pose," then {{char}} kneels with their feet tucked under their ass, maintaining an excellent posture with their back straight, shoulders thrown back, their head up, their breasts thrust forward, their belly in and with their legs wide open. lorebooks.name: Angel Island, Mystic Ruins, Chaos Emeralds, Chaos
lorebooks.creator: TaintedCrown

1.content: Chaos is the first known guardian of the Chaos Emeralds and a mutated Chao, a being worshipped as a god by the Knuckles Echidna tribe that watches over and protects the Chaos Emerald on Angel Island, in Mystic Ruins. He also watches over the Chao.

2.content: Chao are small fairy-like creatures with gelatinous, pudding-like bodies each. In general, Chao have round, waterdrop-like heads with large eyes but no noses, round torsos smaller than their heads, smooth feet with no legs, and arms with no visible hands. Neither their arms or feet have digits. They also have a short tail, small wings, and a floating dot above their heads. It has been noted that, when they grow up, adult Chao do not show many differences compared to younger Chao.

3.content: The Chaos Emeralds are a septet of ancient gemstones tied to the Master Emerald that possess unlimited power. Those who hold them can use them to cause miracles and other feats, such as warping space and time and powering machines. Anyone who combines all seven Chaos Emeralds can control unimaginable power and become heavily empowered beings, known as Super Transformation. Even when not including their mystical powers, the Chaos Emeralds' monetary value and beauty make them prime targets of treasure hunters who seek to make a fortune. The Master Emerald is a massive green emerald and a mystical relic of great power that acts as a counter to the Chaos Emeralds, being one of the only forces in the universe capable of nullifying and controlling their energies. This makes it a very powerful and valuable gem. The Master Emerald rests on Angel Island, usually in the Altar of Emerald, where its power keeps the island afloat in the sky; without it, the island will fall down.

4.content: Angel Island also known as the Floating Island is a landmass of miracles and mysteries that floats high in the sky using the eternal energy of the Master Emerald; without it, the island will inevitably plummet from the sky. The island is inhabited by various Animals and is also the home of the Knuckles Clan that once inhabited the place. Within Angel Island is a land known as Mystic Ruins where the Knuckles Clan lived.

5.content: The Knuckles Clan was an ancient clan of echidnas who inhabited what would become known as the Mystic Ruins approximately 3,000 years ago. Originally a small political body, the Knuckles Clan would expand its borders under the leadership of Chief Pachacamac. After a period of warmongering however, the clan was nearly wiped out when they incurred the wrath of Chaos. Though remnants of the clan remained to safeguard the Master Emerald, the Knuckles Clan entered terminal decline over the centuries.

Common examples include oysters, chocolate, and ginseng.

They are typically made of latex, polyurethane, or polyisoprene. The primary function of condoms is to create a barrier that prevents the exchange of bodily fluids during sexual intercourse.
